		Question: who was ptolemy and what did he do
		Answer:
answer: The answer to this question is Ptolemy, a Greek astronomer and mathematician.  He was known for his work on geography, astronomical models, astronomy, and optics. He wrote a number of influential texts, including the Almagest, the Geographike Hyphegesis, and Centiloquium. Ptolemy was one of the greatest mathematicians and astronomers of all time and his contributions to the fields of geography, astronomy, and mathematics were monumental.
